Issues Correctly Identified by the AI.Analysis: AI proposed a full replacement to broaden the definition of 'Permitted Recipient'. HR implemented this by adding 'directors', 'shareholders', and 'potential syndicate members' to the existing clause, achieving the same policy objective.

AI proposed adding exceptions for automated backups and internal work product. HR implemented this change by adding the required exceptions directly into the existing clause, fully aligning with Policy 3.

AI proposed removing the restriction on soliciting employees of affiliated companies. HR correctly removed the affiliate restriction and further improved the clause by reducing the non-solicit term from two years to one.

Issues Correctly Identified by the AI.Issue: Prohibition on Acting as a Consortium
Issues Correctly Identified by the AI.Analysis: AI proposed deleting the clause that forced the company to act as a sole principal. HR implemented this change exactly by deleting the entire clause.
AI proposed replacing the overly broad no-contact clause. HR addressed the core issue by adding a carve-out for contact made in the 'ordinary course of business', satisfying Policy 6.
AI proposed deleting the clause that granted enforceable rights to non-signatories. HR implemented this change exactly by deleting the entire clause.

AI proposed making the one-sided assignment clause mutual and limited to affiliates. HR made the clause mutual but permitted assignment to 'third parties', which is broader than the AI's suggestion but still resolves the primary issue of one-sidedness.
AI proposed changing the governing law from Dutch to Belgian and jurisdiction from Amsterdam to Antwerp. HR implemented this change exactly as suggested.

Issues Missed by the AI.Analysis: AI did not mention this. HR added a specific carve-out, exempting the company from liability for its Representatives' breaches of the non-solicitation clauses (11 and 12).
AI did not mention this. HR added 'use best efforts to' language to the obligation to seek a protective order, changing the liability standard from strict to efforts-based for that specific action.

Issues Flagged by AI but Not Addressed b.Analysis: AI flagged that this clause, which prohibits forming a consortium or making a joint proposal, must be deleted per Policy 2. The clause was left unchanged by HR.
AI proposed changing the general standard of liability for Representatives' breaches from strict to 'best efforts'. HR did not make this change, leaving the stricter standard in place.
AI flagged that the definition of what is excluded from 'Information' was missing a standard exception for information received from a third party. This exception was not added by HR.

High Priority.citation: Information may be made available to employees within your organisation (including employees of subsidiaries and affiliates) and to external consultants who are directly involved in the Proposed Transaction
High Priority.problem: The definition of 'Permitted Recipient' is too narrow. It excludes directors, shareholders, potential syndicate members, and other finance providers, which are required by the playbook.
High Priority.suggested_replacement: Information may be disclosed by you to your affiliates and their respective directors, officers, employees, consultants, advisers, shareholders, potential syndicate members, agents, representatives, and other providers of financing (collectively, 'Representatives'), who need to know such information for the Proposed Transaction, provided you remain responsible for any breach of this agreement by your Representatives.

High Priority.citation: The obligation to return or destroy Information shall not apply to the retention of Information, which is required by any applicable law or regulation
High Priority.problem: The clause does not permit the retention of Information on automated backup systems or within internal work product ('Secondary Information'), which is a mandatory requirement.
High Priority.suggested_replacement: Upon a Provider's written request, you shall return or destroy all Information. However, this obligation shall not apply to: (i) Information you or your Representatives must retain under applicable law, rule, or regulation; (ii) Information saved to electronic media under automatic archiving or data-security procedures; and (iii) reports, notes, or other materials prepared by or on behalf of you that incorporate Information ('Secondary Information'). Any material not returned or destroyed remains subject to this agreement's confidentiality obligations.

High Priority.citation: ...with regard to a job within your company or an associated company or subsidiary of your company...
High Priority.problem: The non-solicitation clause extends to the recipient's affiliated companies, which is prohibited. The restriction must apply only to the recipient entity, not its affiliates or portfolio companies.
High Priority.suggested_replacement: For a period of two (2) year(s) from the date of this agreement, you agree not to directly solicit for employment any employee of the Group with whom you had material contact in connection with the Proposed Transaction. This restriction shall not apply to any of your affiliated portfolio companies, nor to employees who respond to public advertisements, make unsolicited applications, are referred by an unaffiliated recruiter, or whose employment commences more than six (6) months after the date of this agreement.

High Priority.citation: ...enter into or maintain any arrangement with any potential acquirer... in relation to making a joint proposal (or forming any kind of consortium or other co-operation arrangement)...
High Priority.problem: This clause prohibits forming a consortium or making a joint proposal, which forces Strada to act alone. This clause must be deleted.
High Priority.suggested_replacement: This clause must be deleted in its entirety.

High Priority.citation: ...you are acting on your own behalf and not as agent, nominee, trustee, broker or as part of a syndicate or consortium...
High Priority.problem: This clause forces Strada to act as a sole principal and not as part of a syndicate or consortium. This clause must be deleted.
High Priority.suggested_replacement: This clause must be deleted in its entirety.

Medium Priority.citation: ...contact any current or former directors, officers, employees, agents, advisers or other representatives of the Group or the Sellers nor any customers, distributors, suppliers, clients, lenders, shareholders or other counterparts of the Group...
Medium Priority.problem: The no-contact provision is overly broad, restricting contact with customers, suppliers, and other stakeholders. It must be limited to directors, officers, or employees directly involved in the transaction and permit contact in the ordinary course of business.
Medium Priority.suggested_replacement: Without the prior written consent of the Providers, you agree not to contact any directors, officers, or employees of the Group or the Sellers in connection with the Proposed Transaction. This restriction shall not be breached by contact made for another purpose than evaluating or negotiating the Proposed Transaction.

Medium Priority.citation: ...are also for the benefit of each other Provider, as an irrevocable third-party stipulation for no consideration (onherroepelijk derdenbeding om niet).
Medium Priority.problem: The clause explicitly grants enforceable rights to non-signatories ('each other Provider'), which is prohibited by the playbook.
Medium Priority.suggested_replacement: This clause must be deleted in its entirety.

Medium Priority.citation: You shall not directly or indirectly assign or transfer... without the prior written consent... The Company is entitled to assign or transfer... to any of its affiliates or third parties...
Medium Priority.problem: The assignment clause is a one-sided restriction against the recipient. The playbook requires that assignment rights be mutual or the clause be silent.
Medium Priority.suggested_replacement: Each party may assign or transfer its rights and obligations under this agreement to any of its affiliates without the prior written consent of the other party.

Low Priority.citation: You remain fully responsible and accountable for the compliance of the Permitted Recipients with the provisions of this confidentiality agreement.
Low Priority.problem: The agreement imposes strict liability for breaches by Representatives ('Permitted Recipients'). The playbook prefers an efforts-based standard.
Low Priority.suggested_replacement: You will use your best efforts to procure that each of your Representatives who receives any Information is aware of and adheres to the terms of this agreement. You shall be responsible for any breach of the confidentiality obligations of this agreement by your Representatives.

Low Priority.citation: This confidentiality agreement has no bearing on information which... is in or comes into the public domain... is already in or comes into your lawful possession... and/or which is independently developed...
Low Priority.problem: The definition of what is excluded from 'Information' is incomplete. It is missing the standard exception for information received from a third party that is not under a confidentiality obligation.
Low Priority.suggested_replacement: Information does not include information that: (a) is or becomes generally available to the public through no breach by you of the confidentiality undertakings hereunder; (b) was in your lawful possession before receipt from a Provider, without any obligation of confidentiality; (c) was received in good faith by you from a third party not under an obligation of confidentiality to a Provider; or (d) was disclosed by you with the written permission of an authorized representative of the Provider.

Low Priority.citation: ...governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the Netherlands. Any disputes... shall be submitted to the exclusive jurisdiction of the District Court in Amsterdam, the Netherlands.
Low Priority.problem: The agreement specifies Dutch law and Amsterdam courts. While acceptable as a European jurisdiction, the playbook preference is for Belgian law and the courts of Antwerp.
Low Priority.suggested_replacement: This agreement, and any contractual or non-contractual obligations arising out of or in connection with it, shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of Belgium. Any disputes arising out of or in connection with this agreement shall be submitted to the exclusive jurisdiction of the competent courts in Antwerp, division Antwerp, Belgium.

hr_edits_data.issue: Correction aligning with High Priority Policy 2
hr_edits_data.citation: Context: 'Information may be made available to ++[directors and]++ employees within your organisation (including ++[directors and]++ employees of subsidiaries and affiliates) and to ++[shareholders, potential syndicate members or]++ external consultants...'
hr_edits_data.problem: The definition of 'Permitted Recipient' was expanded to include 'directors', 'shareholders', and 'potential syndicate members'. This is a positive change that aligns with High Priority Policy 2, which requires a broad definition of who can receive confidential information.

hr_edits_data.citation: Context: '...you remain fully responsible and accountable for the compliance of the Permitted Recipients with the provisions of this confidentiality agreement, ++ [except for clause 11 and 12]++.'
hr_edits_data.problem: An exception was added to Strada's liability for its Representatives, specifically carving out responsibility for breaches of the non-solicitation clauses (11 and 12). This change is not covered by a specific policy but is favorable to Strada as it reduces liability. It relates to the principles in Policy 13.

hr_edits_data.issue: Correction aligning with Low Priority Policy 13
hr_edits_data.citation: Context: '...and you will, and ++[use best efforts to]++ procure that the Permitted Recipients will, (i) use best efforts to obtain a protective order...'
hr_edits_data.problem: The phrase 'use best efforts to' was added, changing the standard of liability for Representatives' actions from a strict one ('procure') to an efforts-based one. This aligns perfectly with Low Priority Policy 13, which favors an efforts-based standard.

hr_edits_data.issue: Correction aligning with High Priority Policy 3
hr_edits_data.citation: Context: 'The obligation to return or destroy Information shall not apply to [++(i) Information...saved to electronic carriers under automatic archiving..., (ii) reports, notes or other materials...which incorporate Information ('Secondary Information'), (iii)]++ the retention of Information, which is required by any applicable law...'
hr_edits_data.problem: Exceptions to the obligation to destroy information were added. The new text correctly allows for the retention of information on automated backups and in internal work product ('Secondary Information'), bringing the clause into full compliance with High Priority Policy 3.

hr_edits_data.issue: Correction aligning with High Priority Policy 4
hr_edits_data.citation: Original: 'For a period of two year... approach nor have a third party approach any employee... or within one of its associated companies or subsidiaries...' New: 'For a period of one year... approach any employee...'
hr_edits_data.problem: Multiple changes were made to align with High Priority Policy 4. The term was reduced from 2 to 1 year (compliant), the restriction on approaching affiliates/subsidiaries was removed (compliant), and the scope was narrowed to direct approaches only. These changes correctly bring the clause into compliance.

hr_edits_data.issue: Correction aligning with Medium Priority Policy 6
hr_edits_data.citation: Original: '...and procure that no Permitted Recipient will... contact any... representatives... in connection with the Proposed Transaction.' New: '...contact any... representatives... in connection with the Proposed Transaction. ++ You shall not be deemed to have breached this obligation in the event of contact in the ordinary course of business... ++'
hr_edits_data.problem: An exception for contact made in the 'ordinary course of business' was added. This is a required change under Medium Priority Policy 6. Additionally, the strict liability for representatives' actions ('procure that no Permitted Recipient will') was removed, which is a favorable change aligning with the principles of Policy 13.

hr_edits_data.issue: Correction aligning with Medium Priority Policy 7
hr_edits_data.citation: Context: '--The undertakings given by you under this confidentiality agreement are given to the Company but are also for the benefit of each other Provider, as an irrevocable third-party stipulation for no consideration (*onherroepelijk derdenbeding om niet*).--'
hr_edits_data.problem: A clause granting rights to third-party beneficiaries ('each other Provider') was deleted. This removal is required by Medium Priority Policy 7 to prevent non-signatories from gaining enforceable rights.

hr_edits_data.issue: Correction aligning with High Priority Policy 2
hr_edits_data.citation: Context: '--You acknowledge and confirm that you are acting on your own behalf and not as agent... or as part of a syndicate or consortium and that you envisage to consummate the Proposed Transaction yourself in its entirety.--'
hr_edits_data.problem: A clause that forced Strada to act alone and prohibited acting as part of a consortium was deleted. This removal is required by High Priority Policy 2, which mandates that such restrictions must be deleted.

hr_edits_data.citation: Original: '--You shall not directly or indirectly assign or transfer... without the prior written consent of the Company--.' New: '++You and ++the Company are entitled to assign or transfer... to any of its affiliates or third parties from time to time.'
hr_edits_data.problem: The one-sided restriction on assignment was correctly removed and made mutual. However, the new clause permits assignment to 'third parties', which is broader than the 'affiliates' specified in the approved language of Medium Priority Policy 9. This introduces a deviation by allowing overly broad assignment rights.

hr_edits_data.issue: Correction aligning with Low Priority Policy 11
hr_edits_data.citation: Original: '...governed by... the laws of --the Netherlands--... exclusive jurisdiction of the --District Court-- in --Amsterdam, the Netherlands--.' New: '...governed by... the laws of ++Belgium++... exclusive jurisdiction of the ++courts++ in ++Antwerp, division Antwerp, Belgium++.'
hr_edits_data.problem: The governing law and jurisdiction were changed from the Netherlands/Amsterdam to Belgium/Antwerp. This change brings the clause into perfect alignment with Strada's preferred position as stated in Low Priority Policy 11.
